seo.title: Wan 2.6 AI Video Generator (Text, Image & Reference) – MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Generate 5–15s cinematic clips (Text/Image) with Wan 2.6 inside MaxVideoAI. Use multi-shot prompts, animate a still image, or keep subject consistency with 1–3 reference videos (5–10s). 720p/1080p, per-second pricing.

overview: Wan 2.6 in MaxVideoAI: multi-shot 5–15s clips from text or a still image, plus reference-to-video (5–10s) for subject consistency across variations. 720p/1080p output, optional audio on T2V/I2V, pay-as-you-go pricing.

hero.title: Wan 2.6 – Multi-shot AI video (Text/Image 5–15s, Reference 5–10s, 720p/1080p)
hero.intro: Structured, multi-shot clips with stronger subject consistency — especially when you start from references.

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: Text prompts, single image still, or 1–3 reference videos

technicalOverview.label: Audio
technicalOverview.body: Optional audio URL on Text/Image modes; disabled on Reference mode

promptStructure.title: Prompting Wan 2.6
promptStructure.quote: Multi-shot prompt with timestamps: [0-3s] shot description... [3-8s] transition... [8-15s] final beat.
promptStructure.description: Write shot-level prompts with timestamps, then describe camera, motion, and lighting.

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Use timestamped shots for mini narratives and clean transitions.
For I2V, describe motion and camera instead of re-describing the image.
For R2V, tag references as @Video1/@Video2/@Video3 in the prompt.
R2V supports 5–10s; plan longer stories as multiple clips.

prompts.title: Vertical social mini-trailer (T2V)
prompts.prompt: Vertical 9:16, premium social ad. Shot 1 [0-3s] Macro of a product on a wet black surface, slow push-in, specular highlights. Shot 2 [3-8s] Whip pan reveal to a hand picking it up, soft rim light, bokeh city at night. Shot 3 [8-15s] Clean hero shot, subtle rotation, no text, no watermark.

prompts.title: Packshot motion (I2V)
prompts.prompt: Continue from first frame. Slow dolly-in, gentle parallax, soft light sweep across the label, tiny dust particles, premium studio look, no text.

prompts.title: Reference dance battle (R2V)
prompts.prompt: Dance battle between @Video1 and @Video2 in an empty museum hall. @Video1 starts center-left, @Video2 enters from right. Dynamic camera orbit, dramatic lighting.

faqs.a: Audio URLs are optional for Text and Image modes. Reference mode does not support audio uploads.

faqs.q: How many reference videos can I upload?
faqs.a: 1–3 MP4/MOV references. Tag them in the prompt as @Video1, @Video2, and @Video3.
Text and Image modes: 5, 10, or 15 seconds. Reference mode: 5 or 10 seconds.

custom.heroSupportLine: Ideal for storyboards, mini-trailers, and product motion where clean transitions matter.
custom.heroDesc1: Wan 2.6 unifies Text, Image, and Reference video inputs in one engine card, so you can iterate on short cinematic beats without switching models.
custom.heroDesc2: Use multi-shot prompts for mini trailers, animate a single still, or lock character consistency using 1–3 reference videos.
heroHighlights: Three modes, one workflow||Pick text, image, or reference video depending on how much control you need.
Timestamped shot lists||Beat-by-beat prompts steer pacing and transitions with less drift.
Reference anchoring||Tag @Video1/@Video2/@Video3 to keep the same subject across variants.
Optional sound bed input||Add a background track for text/image runs; keep reference runs focused on visuals.
custom.whatIntro1: Choose Text, Image, or Reference mode, set duration and resolution, then prompt.
custom.whatIntro2: Reference mode keeps subject identity consistent by grounding the model in real video footage.
whatFlowSteps: 2. Choose Text → Video, Image → Video, or Reference → Video.
3. Set duration, resolution, and aspect ratio (T2V/R2V).
6. See the final price before rendering.
custom.specNote: Specs reflect the live Fal routing today.

specSections.title: Reference-driven consistency
specSections.intro: Supports text, image, and reference-video workflows for stronger subject continuity. Built for multi-shot sequences.
items: Use reference video to anchor a character.

specSections.title: Timestamped control
specSections.intro: Shot lists with timestamps steer pacing and transitions. Clear beat markers work better than adjectives.
items: Limit each beat to one main action.
Add an optional sound bed when needed.

strengths: Use timestamped beats for pacing (2–3 beats max). One clear action per beat.
Repeat the same anchors across beats (subject, wardrobe/props, location, lighting, lens feel) to reduce drift.
For consistency, use Reference mode and tag clips directly in the prompt (@Video1 / @Video2 / @Video3).
Call out transitions (match cut, whip pan, cut on action) instead of “dynamic” wording.
Add a sound bed only when you’re in Text/Image modes; keep Reference runs focused on visuals.
boundaries: Reference mode uses 1–3 videos and expects @Video1/@Video2/@Video3 tags.
Prompts are short-form (800 characters); keep the “must-have” details early.
Audio URL / sound bed is not part of Reference-to-Video in this routing.
comparisonPoints: Wan 2.6 adds Reference → Video for subject consistency
Wan 2.6 supports multi-shot prompts and more aspect ratios
Wan 2.5 includes 480p option and native audio

faqs.a: Audio URLs are optional for Text and Image modes. Reference mode does not support audio uploads.

faqs.q: How many reference videos can I upload?
faqs.a: 1–3 MP4/MOV references. Tag them as @Video1, @Video2, and @Video3 in the prompt.
Text and Image modes: 5, 10, or 15 seconds. Reference mode: 5 or 10 seconds.

custom.relatedSubtitle: Compare price, latency and output options across the MaxVideoAI catalog.
custom.finalPara1: Wan 2.6 is built for short cinematic sequences with multi-shot control.
custom.finalPara2: Start with text or image, then move to reference video for consistency.
custom.galleryIntro: Recent Wan 2.6 renders across text, image, and reference workflows.

quickStartBlocks.title: Text → Video (T2V)
quickStartBlocks.subtitle: fastest way to test an idea
steps: Describe: subject + location + lighting + camera style
Add 2–3 timestamped beats if you want multi-shot
If the mood is right → rerun in 1080p

quickStartBlocks.title: Image → Video (I2V)
quickStartBlocks.subtitle: perfect to animate a key visual
steps: Upload the image (the ratio follows automatically)
Focus on motion (camera + subject) and micro-details (wind, reflections, dust…)

quickStartBlocks.title: Reference → Video (R2V)
quickStartBlocks.subtitle: lock identity / consistency
steps: Ask for a simple shot (not a full film)
Start at 5–10s (10s max) to maximize consistency

troubleshootingItems: Subject changes / drift → reduce beats, repeat anchors in every beat, and switch to Reference with cleaner, tighter-framed videos.
Camera too jittery → replace “dynamic” with “slow, smooth, controlled”; specify “tripod-stable” or “smooth track”.
Beats feel inconsistent → add timestamps ([0–5s], [5–10s]) and make each beat a single readable action.
Look deviates from the key visual → start from Image→Video (hero frame), then only ask for motion; keep the style recipe identical.
Transitions feel jumpy → explicitly name the transition + keep the camera move continuous between beats.
custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Wan 2.6 Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Wan 2.6 follows short prompts with clear subject, scene, and motion; use a simple shot list for multi-shot.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: duration + aspect ratio are set in the UI - your prompt controls subject, motion, camera, style, and optional sound. Keep prompts concise; prompt expansion helps.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Subject + scene + motion in one clear sentence.
For multi-shot, keep it to 2-3 beats.
Add a short negative prompt to avoid artifacts.
custom.tipsIntro: Wan 2.6 is easiest to steer when you use short beats, explicit transitions, and reference anchoring when identity must stay stable.
promptingEngineWhy: Prompt expansion handles short, concrete prompts.
Reference mode works best when you specify what must stay consistent.
Audio cues help pacing; keep them minimal.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = style control. Use for precise, repeatable looks.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.
promptingTabs.copy:
[Subject] [motion] in [scene], [camera], [lighting/style], [optional sound cue].
Negative: [text, logos, extra people, blur]

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + key traits.]

Scene:
[Location + time + 2 anchors.]

Motion:
[One clear action + camera move.]

Look:
[Lighting + palette + style.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1-2 cues.]

Negative:
[What to avoid.]

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "studio brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Shot list (same subject + same setting)
Shot 1: [action + camera]
Shot 2: [action + camera]
Shot 3: [final action/reveal]

Look:
[Lighting + palette.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1-2 cues.]

Negative:
[Text/logos/extra characters.]

promptingTabs.label: Storyboard
promptingTabs.title: Storyboard prompt (timestamped beats)
promptingTabs.description: Best for multi-shot sequences in one clip.
promptingTabs.copy:
Shot list (same subject + same setting)
Duration: [5/10/15s]

Beat 1 (0-3s):
[Framing + action + camera move]

Beat 2 (3-7s):
[Framing + action + camera move]

Beat 3 (7-10/15s):
[Final action/reveal + camera settle]

Continuity:
[Repeat anchors: wardrobe, props, lighting, background]
[If using references: tag @Video1/@Video2/@Video3]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1-2 cues]

Negative:
[Text, logos, extra characters, blur]

demoPrompt: Global look: sleek thriller, rainy night, soft neon, 35mm, fine grain, cinematic depth of field, smooth camera, blue/amber palette.
Shot 1 [0–4s]: slow push-in down a wet alley, reflections on the ground, a silhouette in the distance, misty atmosphere.
Shot 2 [4–10s]: cut to close-up of hands opening a sealed envelope on a wooden table, warm side light, very shallow focus.
Shot 3 [10–15s]: door opens into an overexposed white room, flash of light, fine dust in the beam, fade to black.
demoNotes: Audio option: URL to a soft ambient bed 3–15s, low volume.
safetyRules: No sexual content, and nothing involving minors.
No hateful, harassing, or graphic-violence content.
Don’t impersonate real people or public figures; use consent for any likeness/voice.
Don’t include private personal data (addresses, phone numbers, documents, non-consenting faces).
Some prompts or reference videos may be blocked by provider safety filters.
